text:
Winifred Clare "Winkie" Ashby (née Griffin, 17 November 1932 – 11 December 2018) was a New Zealand freestyle swimmer. In the 1950 British Empire Games, she won the silver medal as part of the 4 x 110 yards freestyle relay. She also competed in the 440 and 110 yards freestyle at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games. He was born in Kawakawa, New Zealand.
Ashby died of lung cancer on the Hibiscus Coast, north of Auckland, on 11 December 2018, aged 86.
